text: The 1960–61 season was the 72nd season of competitive football played by Ipswich Town. They finished the season as champions of the Second Division, one point ahead of second-placed Sheffield United, winning promotion to the top flight of English football for the first time in their history. Ray Crawford was the league's top scorer with 40 goals and his strike partner Ted Phillips netted 30 times as Ipswich scored exactly 100 league goals. ==Players== :Players who made one appearance or more for Ipswich Town F.C. during the 1960–61 seasonPride of Anglia – Ipswich Town Football Club Season 1960–61 {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- !rowspan="2"|Pos. !rowspan="2"|Nat. !rowspan="2" width="160"|Name !colspan="2" width="87"| League !colspan="2" width="87"|League Cup !colspan="2" width="87"|FA Cup !colspan="2" width="87"|Total |- !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- |GK | |Roy Bailey |38 |0 |1 |0 |1 |0 |40 |0 |- |GK | |Wilf Hall |4 |0 |0 |0 |0 |0 |4 |0 |- |DF | |Billy Baxter |19 |0 |0 |0 |0 |0 |19 |0 |- |DF | |Larry Carberry |42 |0 |1 |0 |1 |0 |44 |0 |- |DF | |John Compton |3 |0 |0 |0 |0 |0 |3 |0 |- |DF | |John Laurel |3 |0 |1 |0 |0 |0 |4 |0 |- |DF | |Ken Malcolm |41 |0 |1 |0 |1 |0 |43 |0 |- |DF | |Andy Nelson |39 |0 |0 |0 |1 |0 |40 |0 |- |MF | |John Elsworthy |39 |3 |1 |0 |1 |0 |41 |3 |- |MF | |Jimmy Leadbetter |42 |3 |1 |0 |1 |0 |44 |3 |- |MF | |Aled Owen |8 |1 |0 |0 |0 |0 |8 |1 |- |MF | |Reg Pickett |24 |0 |1 |0 |1 |0 |26 |0 |- |MF | |Roy Stephenson |33 |9 |0 |0 |1 |0 |34 |9 |- |FW | |Ray Crawford |42 |40 |1 |0 |1 |0 |44 |40 |- |FW | |Dermot Curtis |5 |3 |0 |0 |0 |0 |5 |3 |- |FW | |Doug Millward |19 |6 |1 |0 |1 |0 |21 |6 |- |FW | |Ted Phillips |42 |30 |1 |0 |1 |0 |44 |30 |- |FW | |Derek Rees |16 |4 |0 |0 |0 |0 |18 |4 |- |FW | |Brian Siddall |3 |0 |1 |0 |0 |0 |4 |0 |} ==League standings== ==Results== :Home team listed firstPride of Anglia – Ipswich Town Football Club Season 1960–61 ===Division Two=== ===League Cup=== ===FA Cup=== ==References== Category:Ipswich Town F.C. seasons Ipswich Town
